channel.title: Unity MP game
channel.description:
This is just something im working on in my spare time, hopefully the end result will be a co-op game but I have not named the thread because im unsure of the final design. I posted this in other games because that other Naruto game is here and it'd be an insult to call unity programming.
Currently im building a basic networking game system and then bringing that over to a co-op Amnesia type game. So I'm going to be working on all the main features before actually fleshing out the game. If you haven't played my first "horror" game check out: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,587255.0.html
No im not using any tutorials. I watched a few but realized their approach to networking was not cheat-proof so I've built this from the ground up as authoritative. I'm also not using unities auto transform sync because its nasty.
This is being built as a general multiplayer base so I can adopt it to any project*
Right now I have (everything below all works in multiplayer): - Full player connecting - Items, ammo - missile launcher for the lulz, it explodes also - basic AI system (may swap out for a node-based navigation system if needed) - AI has health, takes damage, and delivers damage - chat system
The hard part is pretty much done so the rest has been fairly simple. I'm keeping track of almost all stats now I just need to draw it lol, hopefully starting the inventory soon.
Heres some screenshots of my beautiful testing area:
I'm using unity free
[img]http://oi44.tinypic.com/2rhmbcx.jpg[/img]
[img]http://oi42.tinypic.com/2hol0l4.jpg[/img]
[img]http://oi43.tinypic.com/1y7k8p.jpg[/img]

item.title: Unity MP game
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Ill mostly likely go with the pirate game

Ill keep you guys posted. As soon as its playable ill host a web version hosted at my house so everyone can check it out

item.title: Unity MP game
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:19, topic:526708”][quote author=Teem_Rocket link=topic=645454.msg4348787#msg4348787 date=1376331264]

Coop horror or team vs team pirate ship battles complete with cannon damage, multiple ship decks, muskets and swords?

Horror genre co-op for sure if you ask me.
[/quote]
The more and more I think about it the harder it becomes to scare players when theres two of them. Its very hard to scare them both without making it extremely linear, and thats where stuff becomes predictable[/quote]

That’s true. Plus most of the people in our generation have been desensitized so much by scary movies, books, stories, shows, etcetera. If not co-op you’ve already made a single-player game like that, yes? Might as well go with the other idea then I suppose.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:18, topic:526708”][quote author=Frell link=topic=645454.msg4348675#msg4348675 date=1376319193]
Coop horror or team vs team pirate ship battles complete with cannon damage, multiple ship decks, muskets and swords?
[/quote]

Horror genre co-op for sure if you ask me.[/quote]
The more and more I think about it the harder it becomes to scare players when theres two of them. Its very hard to scare them both without making it extremely linear, and thats where stuff becomes predictable

item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:15, topic:526708”]Ok so lately I was playing pirate ship wars on garrysmod and I was thinking of making a more polished version of this game mode in Unity.

Which do you think would be more fun? Coop horror or team vs team pirate ship battles complete with cannon damage, multiple ship decks, muskets and swords?[/quote]
I have a friend who plays pirate ship wars, and I’d rather see a 2 team pirate battle game personally.

item.title: Unity MP game
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:12, topic:526708”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=645454.msg4344601#msg4344601 date=1375685890]

I really enjoy zombie survival games, and I would have loved DayZ if it weren’t for the terrible game-play it had to offer. I understand it wasn’t built into its own project, but the implementation of the mod was terrible, and my experience with the game really made me regret purchasing Arma II. Some of the biggest problems behind the mod are:

[ul][li]Zombies were too glitchy, sometimes even making shooting them hard[/li]
[li]The AI for the zombies was just absolutely terrible[/li]
[li]The general performance of the mod is terrible[/li]
[li]The most exciting thing was coming across a bandit[/li]
[li]Zombies generally posed no threat, unless you run into a town and fire off a bullet (which somehow sends a horde of zombies coming out of no where)[/li][/ul]

If you do stick with this, I’d be glad to support you in any way I can, but I would like to ask you to reconsider your thought about the zombie aspect of it, because if it is done properly, it can turn out really nice.

DayZero solves all of this.
[/quote]
What is this?[/quote]
http://zombies.nu

Read full topic

item.title: Unity MP game
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:5, topic:526708”]Nice, how are you doing networking?
The standard unity way is ugly as fudge and doesnt support complex objects that well :([/quote]
Well im just rolling with the RPC calls for now, but I haven’t really been limited with it at all. I’ve made sure to disable any attempt at unity auto syncing stuff for me by disabling it in the networkView mostly because its a p2p update function and caused tons of issues and I had very little control.

Read full topic
